title: Japanese expansion and British East India Company

content.prompt: The primary rationale for Japan’s territorial acquisitions in Southeast Asia during the period 1933–1942, as reflected in Map 2, was most similar to the primary rationale for which of the following?

choices.label: The Ottoman Empire’s conquest of the Middle East and North Africa
France’s conquests in central and southern Europe under Napoleon
The British East India Company’s takeover of other European states’ colonial possessions in India
The Qing dynasty’s expansion into Central Asia

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
